H0.text: Lumen is the inside of the small intestine, which has many folds called villi and microvilli lined with blood vessels and lymphatic vessels.

H1.text: Reticular is the name for the lining of the small intestine, which has many folds called villi and microvilli lined with blood vessels and lymphatic vessels.

H2.text: Porous is the term used to describe the inside of the small intestine, which has many folds called villi and microvilli lined with both blood vessels and lymphatic vessels.

H3.text: Osmotic is the term for the inside of the small intestine, which has many folds called villi and microvilli lined with blood vessels as well as lymphatic vessels.

A4.text: Lumen (anatomy), the cavity or channel within a tubular structure
